intro: Oncostemum filicinum, commonly known as the fern moss, is a small, delicate plant belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a complex structure with both stems and leaves, and its leaves are typically narrow and feather-like. Oncostemum filicinum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing on rocks or in soil. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in humid forests.
